Anomalous traffic patterns observed orig.Action: Analyze Zeek conn.log for traffic originating from or passing through network devices. Identify deviations from baseline traffic volume, protocol usage, or connection patterns using time series analysis or statistical profiling (e.g., entropy measures on destination ports/IPs).

Changes in network device behavior or ob.Action: Correlate events in Zeek conn.log showing changes in network device behavior (e.g., reboots indicated by connection drops, altered traffic flows) with potential network device configuration changes or reboots (inferred from network behavior or correlated with external logs if available). Look for anomalous traffic originating from the device after such events using correlation analysis.

Execution of network device management C.Action: Monitor Windows Event ID 4688 on designated management servers or endpoints for execution of command-line interfaces (e.g., "ssh", "telnet", "plink.exe", vendor-specific tools) or file transfer utilities (e.g., "tftp.exe", "ftp.exe", "scp.exe"). Analyze command-line arguments for connections to network device IPs or hostnames, or flags indicating file transfer/configuration changes. Use correlation analysis to identify sequences of commands or suspicious argument combinations associated with specific user accounts or source IPs.

Network traffic indicating unscheduled o.Data: Zeek conn.log; Zeek ftp.log; Zeek ssh.log; Zeek http.log
Network traffic indicating unscheduled o.Action: Analyze Zeek conn.log, ftp.log, ssh.log, and http.log for connections involving network devices (as destination or source) on ports associated with file transfer (TFTP 69, FTP 21, SCP/SFTP 22, HTTP/S 80/443 potentially for web management). Identify file transfer events (indicated by logs or high byte counts in conn.log). Compare transfer times and volumes against a baseline of scheduled maintenance/updates using time series analysis. Flag transfers occurring outside established windows or with unusual sizes using outlier detection methods (e.g., IQR).
